page.title: 16Churches
page.content: Honington All Saints church was founded in Norman times, and still boasts a fine Norman decorated entrance . It serves the villages of Honington and Sapiston, the latter having a redundant church. It is a small building with seating for about 60 people, plus choir stalls. A small organ resides at the rear of the building, beneath the square bell-tower housing two working bells. The parish comes under the jurisdiction of Ixworth, and has the unusual distinction of being led by a full-time deaconess. There were at one time two Methodist churches, but the Primitive building has recently been demolished and flint houses built on the site, whilst the other, on Ixworth Road, has been converted into a dwelling.
